file name: spring-.*-5.3.20.jar We don't use http invoker/features of Spring. In addition it's an old vulnerability and reactivated by NVD for some unknown reason. Take a look at the references and discussions
file name: snakeyaml-1.30.jar snakeyaml is being used through redisson->jackson-databind-yaml. There is no yaml usage of Redisson in Ant Media Server

file name: ffmpeg-5.1.2-1.5.8.jar,ffmpeg-platform-5.1.2-1.5.8.jar, cuda-11.8-8.6-1.5.8.jar, cuda-platform-11.8-8.6-1.5.8.jar This vulnerability is about to github actions of the original repo. It's not related to Ant Media Server.
file name: ffmpeg-5.1.2-1.5.8.jar,ffmpeg-platform-5.1.2-1.5.8.jar, ffmpeg-5.1.2-1.5.8-linux-x86.jar This vulnerability is about using mpegvideoencoder. We don't use mpegvideo encoder in our end
file name: ffmpeg-5.1.2-1.5.8.jar,ffmpeg-platform-5.1.2-1.5.8.jar, ffmpeg-5.1.2-1.5.8-linux-x86.jar This vulnerability is about using mpegvideoencoder. We don't use mpegvideo encoder in our end
file name: tomcat-coyote-10.1.19.jar This vulnerability is about Tomcat fails to handle some cases of excessive HTTP headers correctly. We don't have problem with our headers in our end
file name: tomcat-catalina-10.1.34.jar This vulnerability seems to be fixed in 10.1.34 Otherwise, Ant Media Server works on Linux which is a case sensitve OS. So this doesn't affect the software.

file name: ffmpeg-7.1-1.5.11.jar file name: ffmpeg-7.1-1.5.11-linux-arm64.jar This vulnerability causes problem when Ant Media Server pulls a HLS stream as a stream source. If you're not pulling HLS stream from a source, it will not effect you. If you're pulling a stream from a third party resource, then make sure your third party is trusted until there is a fix available for this issue on FFmpeg side. When the fix is available, we'll update the FFmpeg version in Ant Media Server.

file name: ffmpeg-7.1-1.5.11.jar file name: ffmpeg-7.1-1.5.11-linux-arm64.jar We're not using immersive audio so that this vulnerability does not have an impact to Ant Media Server. When the fix is available, we'll also update the FFmpeg version in Ant Media Server.

file name: ffmpeg-7.1-1.5.11.jar file name: ffmpeg-7.1-1.5.11-linux-arm64.jar Ant Media Server get files only as Stream Source and it is on the Admin Control. So Ant Media Server will not be affected by users.
file name: ffmpeg-7.1-1.5.11.jar file name: ffmpeg-7.1-1.5.11-linux-arm64.jar We're not accepting jpeg as source in Ant Media Server.
